meanings.definition: To outwit or defeat by being more clever or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The clever fox outfoxed the hunter by hiding in the bushes.
meanings.sent2: She outfoxed her opponent in the chess game by anticipating their moves.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel outfoxed the bird by stealing its nuts when it wasn't looking.
meanings.sent4: The detective outfoxed the criminal by setting up a clever trap.
meanings.sent5: The sly cat outfoxed the dog by leading it into a dead-end alley.

meanings.definition: To surpass in intelligence or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The wise owl outfoxed all the other birds in the forest with its knowledge.
meanings.sent2: He outfoxed his classmates by solving the difficult riddle first.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon outfoxed the other animals by finding the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: The master chess player outfoxed his opponent with a brilliant move.
meanings.sent5: The cunning magician outfoxed the audience with his mind-bending tricks.
